Documentation: This set of tests covers the basic box structure which is common to all the specifications in the family.

Box(es) with 64-bit lengths (typically mdat)
Box with the length running to end of file (last box)
Basic FTYP box handling
A user box using a UUID type (should be ignored if not recognized)
Free space (two box types)
A box with an 'unknown' code is present in the file and should be ignored.  The box type used for testing could be one of 'junk', 'mess', etc.
This set of tests covers files with 'moov' atoms, used in MP4 and AVC.
A movie box with all its required contents, and at least one track.
Boxes in the 'usual' order for reading, and in the recommended order inside
The 'mdat' first and the 'moov' late, and boxes in the 'moov' in funny order.
There are 64-bit versions of the movie, track, and media headers, that allow long durations and dates after 2040.
The track-enabled bit in the track header.
Track references of some kind are used.
Track groups of some kind are used
An edit list is used on at least one track, and some material in the media is edited out.
There is a video track with video headers
There is an audio track with audio headers
A timed meta-data track

A track with a single image in it.
Data reference atoms using URLs or URNs are used to refer to media in other files.
The compact sample size box is used.
The 64-bit version of the chunk offset table is used, and the chunk offsets have non-zero bits in their upper 32 bits.
At least one track uses composition re-ordering.
At least one track (video, probably) has sync samples marked
At least one track (audio, probably) has a padding bits table for non byte-lengthed Aus
A degradation priority table is used (note that the meaning of the priority values is not established by standard).
A sample group description and sample to group tables are present.
The pre-roll sample group is present ('roll')
The IPMP control box is present
The sub-sample information box (sub-sample structure) is present

The sample scale box (presenting video hint) is present
The progressive download hitn box is present
the shadow sync box (deprecated) is present

The media data is interleaved on a sensible scale (e.g. .5 second) and in order

The sample dependency table is present
There is one track ujsing several sample entries, not just one

Basic movie fragments (movie extends, moof, traf, and trun)
The optional movie extends header is present
The optional Fragment random access box is present
